alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 10 at 11:34PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT THURSDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central West Virginia and northern West Virginia, including the following counties, in central West Virginia, Calhoun. In northern West Virginia, Ritchie and Wirt. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1134 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms earlier in the evening. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Smithville, Brohard, Macfarlan and Burnt House. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
